name: getText
description: Returns a single Text instance for a given text id

fields.description: Limit fields received in response. E.g. fields: id, name or fields items (id, name), see more at [partial response](https://developers.callfire.com/docs.html#partial-response) page.

$block: Represents a text action sent or received by CallFire platform

$ul: **attributes**: Map of user-defined string attributes associated with an action
**batchId**: An id of contact batch associated with an action
**campaignId**: An id of broadcast if given text was sent as a part of text broadcast
**contact**: Represents a contact in CallFire platform. Contains info about the people you want to contact. It allows you to store a user-defined properties for each contact
**deleted**: A deleted contact, deleted contacts are hidden from search results
**externalId**: An external id of a contact for syncing with external sources
**externalSystem**: External system that external id refers to
**extraPhone1**: Phone number in E.164 format (11-digit). Example: 12132000384
**extraPhone2**: Phone number in E.164 format (11-digit). Example: 12132000384
**extraPhone3**: Phone number in E.164 format (11-digit). Example: 12132000384
**firstName**: A first name of a contact
**homePhone**: Phone number in E.164 format (11-digit). Example: 12132000384
**lastName**: A last name of a contact
**mobilePhone**: Phone number in E.164 format (11-digit). Example: 12132000384
**properties**: Map of user-defined string properties for contact
**workPhone**: Phone number in E.164 format (11-digit). Example: 12132000384
**zipcode**: A Zip code of a contact
**created**: The time when the given resource was created, formatted in unix time milliseconds (read only). Example: 1473781817000 for Sat, 05 Jan 1985 14:03:37 GMT

**finalTextResult**: Result of text (SENT, RECEIVED, DNT, TOO_BIG, INTERNAL_ERROR, CARRIER_ERROR, CARRIER_TEMP_ERROR, UNDIALED). See [call states and results](https://developers.callfire.com/results-responses-errors.html)
**fromNumber**: Sender's phone number in E.164 format (11-digit) or short code. Example: 12132000384, 67076
**modified**: The time when the given resource was modified, formatted in unix time milliseconds (read only). Example: 1473781817000 for Sat, 05 Jan 1985 14:03:37 GMT

**records**: List of text records, each record contains additional details: time of sending, cost, current state.  A single contact may have multiple numbers. If given text was sent as part of broadcast with configured retry logic then each text record will contain details about attempted number

**state**: Current state of an action (READY, SELECTED, CALLBACK, DISABLED, FINISHED, DNC, DUP, INVALID, TIMEOUT, PERIOD_LIMIT). See [call states and results](https://developers.callfire.com/results-responses-errors.html)
**toNumber**: Recipient's phone number in E.164 format (11-digit) or short code. Example: 12132000384, 67076
